alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Hancock; Seneca; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seneca, Wyandot, northwestern Crawford and southern Hancock Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a broken line extending from near Tiffin to near Vanlue to near Bluffton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tiffin, Upper Sandusky, Bluffton, Forest, Arlington, Green Springs, New Washington, Bloomville, Sycamore, Vanlue, New Riegel, Chatfield, Carey, Attica, Benton, Nevada, Republic, Mount Blanchard, Wharton and Jenera. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
